Here's a little about me:

When I was eight years old I played my first video game - The Legend of Zelda: Wind Waker. At that moment, I realized how powerful sound and music were to a game's emotional impact and narrative. Since then, I've dedicated myself to sound design and music, becoming proficient in composing, orchestrating and arranging music and sound effects for film and other visual media using the latest technology. I've had the privilege of working with several directors and video game developers. I'd love to help tell your story!

Here's what I do:

  • Composing, orchestrating and arranging music for film, video games, and other forms of media.
  • Mixing/Mastering audio for film, TV, and web based distribution.
  • Using orchestral sample libraries and electronic synthesizers.
  • Building unique sounds and synthesizers from scratch.
  • Writing in DAWs Logic Pro, Pro Tools, Digital Performer, and Cubase.
  • Implementing middlewares FMOD and Wwise.
  • Transcibing in notation softwares Finale, Sibelius, and Dorico.
  • Proficient in both Mac OS X and Windows.

Here's where I studied:

MASTER OF MUSIC | SUMMER 2020 | SEATTLE FILM INSTITUTE Major: Music Composition for Film and Media Studied With: Humie Mann, Akash Thakkar, Ryan Ike, and more BACHELOR OF ARTS | SPRING 2018 | LEE UNIVERSITY Major: Bachelor of Arts in Music- Voice Studied with: David Holsinger, John Wykoff, Alan Elkins, and more
